alert.note: Alert for Adams; Cumberland; Dauphin; Franklin; Lancaster; Lebanon; Perry; York (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Heat Advisory issued September 05 at 3:00PM EDT until September 06 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 7 PM EDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heat index values up to 102 expected. * WHERE...Franklin, Perry, Dauphin, Lebanon, Cumberland, Adams, York and Lancaster Counties. * WHEN...From noon to 7 PM EDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Hot temperatures and high humidity may cause heat illnesses to occur.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay out of the sun, and stay in an air-conditioned room. Check up on relatives and neighbors, and provide pets with adequate water and shelter from the sun. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. This is especially true during hot weather when car interiors can reach lethal temperatures in a matter of minutes. LOOK BEFORE YOU LOCK. If you work or spend time outside. reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing. For excessive heat safety information, visit weather.gov/heat. The latest forecast information can be found on the NWS State College Facebook page and Twitter @NWSStateCollege, or on the web at weather.gov/ctp.
